goal.en: After completion of the course, students should be able to: Gain insight into the interdisciplinary field of data science. Analyze data using machine learning and deep learning techniques. Work with both structured and unstructured datasets. Apply data visualization techniques to interpret results. Conduct scientific literature review on related techniques. Conduct scientific experiments and verify results with statistical evaluation.
goal.ch: After completion of the course, students should be able to: Gain insight into the interdisciplinary field of data science. Analyze data using machine learning and deep learning techniques. Work with both structured and unstructured datasets. Apply data visualization techniques to interpret results. Conduct scientific literature review on related techniques. Conduct scientific experiments and verify results with statistical evaluation.

content.en:
Introduction to Data Science and Machine Learning
Exploring and understanding datasets
Data processing & representation
Natural language processing
Feature selection & extraction
Supervised machine learning techniques
Artificial neural networks
Unsupervised machine learning techniques
Evaluating performance
Interpreting results and data visualization
DS and ML in the real world
Case study I
Case study II
Research project I
Research project II
Final presentation on findings

textbook.en: "C. D. Manning, P. Raghavan and H. Sch?tze, Introduction to Information Retrieval, Cambridge University Press. 2008. L. Igual, S. Segu?, Introduction to Data Science: A Python Approach to Concepts, Techniques and Applications, Springer, 2017 J. Grus, Data Science from Scratch: First Principles with Python, O’Reilly, 2015 *** Note: There is no fixed textbook for this course. You are encouraged to refer to as many materials as possible."
textbook.ch: "C. D. Manning, P. Raghavan and H. Sch?tze, Introduction to Information Retrieval, Cambridge University Press. 2008. L. Igual, S. Segu?, Introduction to Data Science: A Python Approach to Concepts, Techniques and Applications, Springer, 2017 J. Grus, Data Science from Scratch: First Principles with Python, O’Reilly, 2015 *** Note: There is no fixed textbook for this course. You are encouraged to refer to as many materials as possible."

flex_desc.en: Course content and final report will be completed in 16 weeks. After receiving the feedback on the report, students have 2 weeks to revise their report.
flex_desc.ch: 16週完成授課與期末報告，學生收到期末報告評語意見後，有2週的時間可以修改報告內容。

en: Type:Master's Program、Doctoral Program only.Department:Master of Information Management、PhD in Information Management only.

Department:Department of Information Management、Specialty Program-Electronic Commerce、Specialty Program-人工智慧跨域應用(理)、Specialty Program-人工智慧跨域應用(文)、Specialty Program-Fin Tech only.Year:Fourth Year only.
ch: 學制:限碩士班、博士班。系所:限資訊管理學系碩士班、資訊管理學系博士班。
系所:限資訊管理學系、學分學程-電子商務(EC)、學分學程-人工智慧跨域應用(理)、學分學程-人工智慧跨域應用(文)、學分學程-金融科技。年級:限四年級。
